description: Embattled leader Alexander Lukashenko may not find long-term solace in Russia, Sarah Rainsford writes.
title: Kremlin looks to keep protest-torn Belarus in Moscow's orbit
title_page: Kremlin looks to keep protest-torn Belarus in Moscow's orbit - BBC News
maintext: That point was double-underlined by the opening of a week-long joint military exercise in western Belarus on the same day as the talks in Sochi. Mr Putin then announced that there would be further joint events "almost every month" - another sign that he will not allow Alexander Lukashenko to be swept away by "people power".
